definition: To move closer to something; a way of doing something.
examples: Dark clouds are approaching from the west. (verb)
Our approach to the project is step by step. (noun)

definition: A hole or tunnel made by an animal; to dig or press into something.
examples: The rabbit hid in its burrow. (noun)
Moles burrow under the garden. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Burrow = borrow the ground for a home.

definition: To stop doing something; a stopping or end.
examples: The rain ceased by afternoon. (verb)
They called for a cease of hostilities. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Cease = peace and stop sound similar.

examples: Destructive winds tore off roofs.
That habit can be destructive to health.
The warm room made me drowsy.
He felt drowsy after lunch.
After the hike, we were famished.
The pups looked famished and tired.

extra.memory_tip: Famished = food vanishing makes you famished.

definition: A prediction of future conditions; to predict what will happen.
examples: The weather forecast says it will snow. (noun)
Scientists forecast higher rainfall this year. (verb)

definition: To spend the winter in a deep sleep to save energy.
examples: Some bears hibernate in cold months.
Tortoises hibernate until spring arrives.

extra.memory_tip: Hibernate = hide and wait through winter.

definition: To move from one place to another, often seasonally.
examples: Swallows migrate south for winter.
Caribou migrate across the tundra.

definition: To settle snugly and comfortably; to be located in a sheltered spot.
examples: Kittens nestled beside their mother.
The village nestles in the hills.

extra.memory_tip: Nestle = get cosy like in a nest.

definition: To watch carefully; to notice or follow rules or traditions.
examples: We observed the ants carrying crumbs.
Please observe the safety rules.

extra.memory_tip: Observe = use keen eyes and mind.

definition: To make ready before something happens.
examples: We prepared lunch together.
Athletes prepare for months before a race.

extra.memory_tip: Prepare = pre-pair—pair things up in advance.

definition: To make something smaller or less in amount, size, or degree.
examples: Turn off lights to reduce energy use.
They reduced prices during the sale.

extra.memory_tip: Reduce = re-do to a smaller size.

examples: The storm caused severe damage.
She has a severe peanut allergy.

definition: A risky journey or project; to go somewhere or do something risky or new.
examples: Starting the café was a brave venture. (noun)
They ventured into the cave with torches. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Venture = adventure with a bit of risk.
